summary.para: Determines the relative order of two items in their item identifier lists, and hence in the UI.

param.name: csfFlags
param.para: Type:
A flag that specifies how the comparison should be performed. The parameter should be one of the values in .

param.name: dwCategoryId1
param.para: Type: DWORD
A DWORD that specifies the first category identifier to use in the comparison.

param.name: dwCategoryId2
param.para: Type: DWORD
A DWORD that specifies the second category identifier to use in the comparison.

returns.para: If this method is successful, the CODE field of the HRESULT contains a value that specifies the outcome of the comparison, otherwise it returns a COM error code.

remarks.para: The following table shows the values returned in the CODE field of the HRESULT.

listheader.description: The first item should precede the second (dwCategoryId1 < dwCategoryId2).

item.description: The first item should follow the second (dwCategoryId1 > dwCategoryId2).
The two items are the same (dwCategoryId1 = dwCategoryId2).

summary.para: Gets a list of categories associated with a list of identifiers.

param.name: cidl
param.para: Type: UINT
The number of items in an item identifier list array.

param.name: apidl
param.para: Type: PCUITEMID_CHILD_ARRAY*
A pointer to an array of cidl item identifier list pointers.

param.name: rgCategoryIds
param.para: Type: DWORD*
When this method returns, contains a pointer to an array of cidl category identifiers.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The ICategorizer.GetCategory method accepts an array of pointers to item identifier lists (PIDLs) and fills an array of category identifiers.
Important The value -1 is an invalid category identifier.

summary.para: Gets information about a category, such as the default display and the text to display in the UI.

param.name: dwCategoryId
param.para: Type: DWORD
A DWORD that specifies a category identifier.

param.name: pci
param.para: Type: *
When this method returns, contains a pointer to a structure that contains the category information.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets the name of a categorizer, such as Group By Device Type, that can be displayed in the UI.

param.name: pszDesc
param.para: Type: LPWSTR
When this method returns, contains a pointer to a string of length cch that contains the categorizer name.

param.name: cch
param.para: Type: UINT
The number of characters in the pszDesc buffer.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: In the case of the system folder view object, if the description at pszDesc matches one of the category names listed in the folder's Arrange Icons By menu, a dot is placed by that name when the menu is displayed, either through the View menu or through the context menu.

summary.para: Exposes methods that are used to obtain information about item identifier lists.
